regulation.title: Occupational Safety and Health Standards - Personal Protective Equipment
regulation.applies_to: all general industry workplaces covered under 29 CFR part 1910

rules.text: Protective equipment, including personal protective equipment for eyes, face, head, and extremities, protective clothing, respiratory devices, and protective shields and barriers, shall be provided, used, and maintained in a sanitary and reliable condition wherever it is necessary by reason of hazards of processes or environment, chemical hazards, radiological hazards, or mechanical irritants encountered in a manner capable of causing injury or impairment in the function of any part of the body through absorption, inhalation or physical contact.
rules.requirement: provide, use, and maintain protective equipment in sanitary and reliable condition when hazards are present

triggers.expression: process_hazards OR chemical_hazards OR radiological_hazards OR mechanical_irritants

rules.text: The employer shall assess the workplace to determine if hazards are present, or are likely to be present, which necessitate the use of personal protective equipment (PPE). If such hazards are present, or likely to be present, the employer shall: (i) Select, and have each affected employee use, the types of PPE that will protect the affected employee from the hazards identified in the hazard assessment; (ii) Communicate selection decisions to each affected employee; and, (iii) Select PPE that properly fits each affected employee.
rules.requirement: conduct workplace hazard assessment and select appropriate PPE for each affected employee

conditions.parameter: hazards present or likely to be present

rules.text: The employer shall verify that the required workplace hazard assessment has been performed through a written certification that identifies the workplace evaluated; the person certifying that the evaluation has been performed; the date(s) of the hazard assessment; and, which identifies the document as a certification of hazard assessment.
rules.requirement: provide written certification of hazard assessment with specified information

rules.text: The employer shall provide training to each employee who is required by this section to use PPE. Each such employee shall be trained to know at least the following: (i) When PPE is necessary; (ii) What PPE is necessary; (iii) How to properly don, doff, adjust, and wear PPE; (iv) The limitations of the PPE; and, (v) The proper care, maintenance, useful life and disposal of the PPE.
rules.requirement: provide comprehensive PPE training covering when, what, how to use, limitations, and maintenance

rules.text: Each affected employee shall demonstrate an understanding of the training specified in paragraph (f)(1) of this section, and the ability to use PPE properly, before being allowed to perform work requiring the use of PPE.
rules.requirement: verify employee demonstrates understanding and proper PPE use before allowing work

rules.text: Except as provided by paragraphs (h)(2) through (h)(6) of this section, the protective equipment, including personal protective equipment (PPE), used to comply with this part, shall be provided by the employer at no cost to employees.
rules.requirement: provide PPE at no cost to employees except for specified exceptions

items.description: non-specialty safety-toe protective footwear and non-specialty prescription safety eyewear permitted for off-job use
shoes or boots with built-in metatarsal protection when employer provides metatarsal guards

exceptions.expression: non_specialty_footwear OR metatarsal_protection OR logging_boots OR everyday_clothing

rules.text: The employer shall ensure that each affected employee uses appropriate eye or face protection when exposed to eye or face hazards from flying particles, molten metal, liquid chemicals, acids or caustic liquids, chemical gases or vapors, or potentially injurious light radiation.
rules.requirement: ensure employees use appropriate eye or face protection when exposed to specified hazards

conditions.parameter: exposure to acids or caustic liquids
exposure to chemical gases or vapors
exposure to potentially injurious light radiation

triggers.expression: flying_particles OR molten_metal OR liquid_chemicals OR acids_caustics OR chemical_gases OR light_radiation

rules.text: The employer shall ensure that each affected employee uses equipment with filter lenses that have a shade number appropriate for the work being performed for protection from injurious light radiation.
rules.requirement: use filter lenses with appropriate shade number for protection from injurious light radiation

conditions.parameter: shielded metal arc welding electrode size

triggers.expression: (shielded_metal_arc_welding_lt3 AND arc_current_lt60) OR gas_welding_light OR oxygen_cutting_light

rules.text: In the control of those occupational diseases caused by breathing air contaminated with harmful dusts, fogs, fumes, mists, gases, smokes, sprays, or vapors, the primary objective shall be to prevent atmospheric contamination. This shall be accomplished as far as feasible by accepted engineering control measures (for example, enclosure or confinement of the operation, general and local ventilation, and substitution of less toxic materials). When effective engineering controls are not feasible, or while they are being instituted, appropriate respirators shall be used pursuant to this section.
rules.requirement: implement engineering controls as primary method, use respirators when engineering controls not feasible

conditions.parameter: engineering controls not feasible or being instituted

rules.text: In any workplace where respirators are necessary to protect the health of the employee or whenever respirators are required by the employer, the employer shall establish and implement a written respiratory protection program with worksite-specific procedures.
rules.requirement: establish and implement written respiratory protection program with worksite-specific procedures
rules.applies_to: employers where respirators are necessary or required

rules.text: The employer shall select a NIOSH-certified respirator. The respirator shall be used in compliance with the conditions of its certification.
rules.requirement: select NIOSH-certified respirator and use in compliance with certification conditions

rules.text: The employer shall provide the following respirators for employee use in IDLH atmospheres: (A) A full facepiece pressure demand SCBA certified by NIOSH for a minimum service life of thirty minutes, or (B) A combination full facepiece pressure demand supplied-air respirator (SAR) with auxiliary self-contained air supply.
rules.requirement: provide specified respirators for IDLH atmospheres with minimum 30-minute service life

conditions.parameter: immediately dangerous to life or health atmosphere

protections: combination SAR with auxiliary air supply

rules.text: The employer shall provide a medical evaluation to determine the employee's ability to use a respirator, before the employee is fit tested or required to use the respirator in the workplace.
rules.requirement: provide medical evaluation before fit testing or workplace respirator use

rules.text: The employer shall ensure that an employee using a tight-fitting facepiece respirator is fit tested prior to initial use of the respirator, whenever a different respirator facepiece (size, style, model or make) is used, and at least annually thereafter.
rules.requirement: conduct fit testing before initial use, when changing respirator, and annually

rules.text: If the fit factor, as determined through an OSHA-accepted QNFT protocol, is equal to or greater than 100 for tight-fitting half facepieces, or equal to or greater than 500 for tight-fitting full facepieces, the QNFT has been passed with that respirator.
rules.requirement: achieve minimum fit factor of 100 for half facepieces or 500 for full facepieces

rules.text: Compressed breathing air shall meet at least the requirements for Grade D breathing air described in ANSI/Compressed Gas Association Commodity Specification for Air, G-7.1-1989, to include: (A) Oxygen content (v/v) of 19.5-23.5%; (B) Hydrocarbon (condensed) content of 5 milligrams per cubic meter of air or less; (C) Carbon monoxide (CO) content of 10 ppm or less; (D) Carbon dioxide content of 1,000 ppm or less; and (E) Lack of noticeable odor.
rules.requirement: ensure compressed breathing air meets Grade D specifications with specified purity levels

triggers.expression: oxygen_content_min AND oxygen_content_max AND hydrocarbon_content AND co_content AND co2_content

rules.text: The employer shall ensure that each affected employee wears a protective helmet when working in areas where there is a potential for injury to the head from falling objects.
rules.requirement: ensure employees wear protective helmets when potential for head injury from falling objects exists

conditions.parameter: potential for injury from falling objects

rules.text: The employer shall ensure that a protective helmet designed to reduce electrical shock hazard is worn by each such affected employee when near exposed electrical conductors which could contact the head.
rules.requirement: ensure employees wear electrical shock-resistant helmets when near exposed electrical conductors

conditions.parameter: near exposed electrical conductors that could contact head

rules.text: The employer shall ensure that each affected employee uses protective footwear when working in areas where there is a danger of foot injuries due to falling or rolling objects, or objects piercing the sole, or when the use of protective footwear will protect the affected employee from an electrical hazard, such as a static-discharge or electric-shock hazard, that remains after the employer takes other necessary protective measures.
rules.requirement: ensure employees use protective footwear when danger of foot injuries or electrical hazards exist

conditions.parameter: danger of foot injuries from falling objects
danger of foot injuries from rolling objects

triggers.expression: falling_objects_danger OR rolling_objects_danger OR piercing_objects_danger OR electrical_hazard

subsections.title: Design requirements for specific types of electrical protective equipment

rules.text: Equipment shall be capable of withstanding the ac proof-test voltage specified in Table I-1 or the dc proof-test voltage specified in Table I-2.
rules.requirement: electrical protective equipment must withstand specified proof-test voltages

triggers.expression: class_00_equipment OR class_0_equipment OR class_1_equipment OR class_2_equipment

subsections.title: In-service care and use of electrical protective equipment

rules.text: Insulating equipment shall be inspected for damage before each day's use and immediately following any incident that can reasonably be suspected of causing damage. Insulating gloves shall be given an air test, along with the inspection.
rules.requirement: inspect insulating equipment daily and after incidents, conduct air test for gloves

rules.text: Electrical protective equipment shall be subjected to periodic electrical tests. Test voltages and the maximum intervals between tests shall be in accordance with Table I-4 and Table I-5.
rules.requirement: conduct periodic electrical tests according to specified intervals and voltages

rules.text: Employers shall select and require employees to use appropriate hand protection when employees' hands are exposed to hazards such as those from skin absorption of harmful substances; severe cuts or lacerations; severe abrasions; punctures; chemical burns; thermal burns; and harmful temperature extremes.
rules.requirement: select and require appropriate hand protection when hands exposed to specified hazards

triggers.expression: skin_absorption_hazard OR cut_laceration_hazard OR abrasion_hazard OR puncture_hazard OR chemical_burn_hazard OR thermal_burn_hazard OR temperature_extreme_hazard

rules.text: Lanyards and vertical lifelines must have a minimum breaking strength of 5,000 pounds (22.2 kN).
rules.requirement: ensure lanyards and vertical lifelines have minimum breaking strength of 5,000 pounds

rules.text: D-rings, snaphooks, and carabiners must be capable of sustaining a minimum tensile load of 5,000 pounds (22.2 kN).
rules.requirement: ensure D-rings, snaphooks, and carabiners sustain minimum tensile load of 5,000 pounds

rules.text: D-rings, snaphooks, and carabiners must be proof tested to a minimum tensile load of 3,600 pounds (16 kN) without cracking, breaking, or incurring permanent deformation. The gate strength of snaphooks and carabiners must be capable of withstanding a minimum load of 3,600 pounds (16 kN) without the gate separating from the nose of the snaphook or carabiner body by more than 0.125 inches (3.175 mm).
rules.requirement: proof test hardware to 3,600 pounds without failure and gate separation limit of 0.125 inches

rules.text: Anchorages, except window cleaners' belt anchors covered by paragraph (e) of this section, must be: Capable of supporting at least 5,000 pounds (22.2 kN) for each employee attached.
rules.requirement: ensure anchorages support minimum 5,000 pounds per attached employee

items.description: window cleaners' belt anchors covered by paragraph (e)

rules.text: Limit the maximum arresting force on the employee to 1,800 pounds (8 kN).
rules.requirement: limit maximum arresting force to 1,800 pounds

rules.text: Bring the employee to a complete stop and limit the maximum deceleration distance the employee travels to 3.5 feet (1.1 m).
rules.requirement: limit maximum deceleration distance to 3.5 feet

rules.text: Personal fall arrest systems are rigged in such a manner that the employee cannot free fall more than 6 feet (1.8 m) or contact a lower level. A free fall may be more than 6 feet (1.8 m) provided the employer can demonstrate the manufacturer designed the system to allow a free fall of more than 6 feet and tested the system to ensure a maximum arresting force of 1,800 pounds (8 kN) is not exceeded.
rules.requirement: limit free fall to 6 feet unless system designed and tested for greater distances

conditions.parameter: manufacturer designed and tested for greater fall
maximum arresting force verified not to exceed 1,800 pounds

items.description: system designed and tested by manufacturer for greater than 6 feet free fall with verified 1,800 pound force limit

rules.text: All positioning systems, except window cleaners' positioning systems, are capable of withstanding, without failure, a drop test consisting of a 4-foot (1.2-m) drop of a 250-pound (113-kg) weight.
rules.requirement: positioning systems must withstand 4-foot drop test with 250-pound weight

rules.text: All window cleaners' positioning systems must: Be capable of withstanding without failure a drop test consisting of a 6-foot (1.8-m) drop of a 250-pound (113-kg) weight.
rules.requirement: window cleaners' systems must withstand 6-foot drop test with 250-pound weight
protections: enhanced drop test for window cleaning

rules.text: Limit the initial arresting force on the falling employee to not more than 2,000 pounds (8.9 kN), with a duration not exceeding 2 milliseconds and any subsequent arresting forces to not more than 1,000 pounds (4.5 kN).
rules.requirement: limit initial arresting force to 2,000 pounds for 2 milliseconds, subsequent forces to 1,000 pounds

rules.text: Each window anchor is capable of supporting a minimum load of 6,000 pounds (26.5 kN).
rules.requirement: window anchors must support minimum 6,000 pounds
